title: Agent Metadata Specification
description: A standardized framework for defining AI Agent identity, configuration, lineage, and risk controls

identification.description: Core identifying, descriptive, and governance details of the agent.

agent_id.description: A unique, permanent identifier for the agent (e.g., HR-POL-003)

agent_version.description: The current version number of the agent's configuration and logic

title.description: The human-readable name of the agent (e.g., Internal HR Policy Assistant)

description.description: A concise summary of the agent's purpose, capabilities, and target user

goal_orientation.description: The specific objective or success metric the agent is designed to achieve

role.description: The defined character or communication style that governs its interaction

owner.description: The team or department responsible for the agent's maintenance and cost

environment.description: The deployment environment (e.g., DEV, UAT, PROD)

tags.description: A list of keywords for search and categorization (e.g., HR, policy, internal)

governance_status.description: The current governance lifecycle status (e.g., DRAFT, APPROVED, DECOMMISSIONED)

reviewer.description: Name of the person who approved the latest governance status.

configuration.description: Configuration details governing agent behavior and capabilities.

prompt_template_reference.description: ID of the prompt template used to guide LLM behavior.

access_scope.description: Overall data access level of the agent.

data_freshness_policy.description: Maximum acceptable age of cached data.

autonomy_level.description: Degree of independent action without human approval.

multimodal_capability.description: Types of input the agent can process.

relations.description: Relationships between the agent and other objects

name.description: The foundational model used by the agent (e.g., gemini-2.5-flash)

version_number.description: The version number of the LLM model

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the prompt template used to guide LLM behavior

name.description: The name of the prompt template used to guide LLM behavior (e.g., ABC-RAG-Standard-V2)

description.description: The actual prompts used to guide LLM behavior

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the external system used for long-term data/vector storage

name.description: The name of the external system used for long-term data/vector storage (e.g., Atlas-HR-RAG-VectorDB)

type.description: The type of memory storage used (e.g., VECTOR_DB, KEY_VALUE_STORE)

identifier.description: A Unique ID for the knowledge source

name.description: A list of all specific knowledge sources (e.g., databases, documents) the agent can access

access_mechanism.description: The protocol or service used to retrieve knowledge (e.g., REST API, SQL connector)

source_object_id.description: Unique ID as in the Source system

source_object_type.description: Type of Source Object (e.g., Agent, MCP Server, Table, Column, View, File, Folder)

target_object_id.description: Unique ID as in the Target system

target_object_type.description: Type of Target Object (e.g., Agent, MCP Server, Table, Column, View, File, Folder)

tool.description: Tool definition and attributes configured for the agent.

identifier.description: A unique reference ID for the tool (e.g., PolicySearchTool)

description.description: Detailed explanation of the purpose and functionality

delegation_possible.description: Boolean indicating if the agent can pass the request to another agent

allowed_delegates.description: A list of Agent IDs, which the agent is allowed to delegate to

input_or_output.description: Indicates whether it is an input or output parameter

parameter_type.description: Required type and format of the parameter

relations.description: Relationships between the tool and other objects

name.description: The name of the MCP server

url.description: The URL of the MCP server

version_number.description: The version number of the MCP server

relations.description: Relationships between the MCP server and other objects

uses.description: Objects that this MCP server uses

guardrail.description: Guardrail definition and attributes used by the agent.

name.description: The name of the guardrail used by the agent (e.g., Prompt Injection, Toxic Content, Model Denial-of-Service)

model.description: The name of the model or application that implements the guardrail

ai_use_case.description: AI Use Case definition and attributes.

identifier.description: A unique reference ID for the AI use case

name.description: The name of the AI use case

description.description: Description of the AI use case

proposed_by.description: Name of the person who proposed the AI use case

owner.description: Name of the business owner of the AI use case

function.description: Name of the business function that owns the AI use case

problem_statement.description: Detailed description of the business problem addressed by the AI use case

expected_benefits.description: Description of the quantitative and qualitative benefits of the AI use case

priority.description: Priority assigned to the AI use case (e.g., Critical, High, Medium, Low)

status.description: Status of the AI use case (e.g., Assess, Authorize, Build, Test, Deploy, Completed, Cancelled)

relations.description: Relationships between the AI use case and other objects

uses.description: Objects that this AI use case uses

identifier.description: A unique reference ID for the application

business_criticality.description: The criticality of the application to the operation of the business (e.g., Low, Medium, High)

emergency_tier.description: The impact to the business if the application is inoperable (e.g., Non-Critical, Business Critical, Mission Critical)

relations.description: Relationships between the application and other objects

identifier.description: The ID of the business process that uses the agent

name.description: The human-readable name of the business process

description.description: A brief description of the business process, its significance and relevance

business_criticality.description: The criticality of the process to the operation of the business (e.g., Low, Medium, High)

relations.description: Relationships between the business process and other objects

uses.description: Objects that this business process uses

name.description: The name of the regulation (e.g., EU AI Act)

regulatory_authority.description: The name of the regulatory authority (e.g., European Union)

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction of the regulation (e.g., European Union, California)

relations.description: Relationships between the regulation and other objects

identifier.description: The ID of the risk assessment

name.description: The name of the risk assessment (e.g., Agent-02-2Q26)

date.description: The date of the risk assessment

risk_score.description: The risk score assigned to the subject (application, business process, AI use case, agent) of the risk assessment

state.description: Status of the risk assessment (e.g., Ready to Take, In Progress, Completed, Cancelled)

relations.description: Relationships between the risk assessment and other objects

assesses.description: Objects that this risk assessment assesses

medical_device.description: Agent metadata definition for medical devices.

agent_id.description: A unique, permanent identifier for the agent

name.description: Name of the agent (e.g., Sepsis ImmunoScore)

is_medical_device.description: Boolean indicating if the agent constitutes a medical device

fda_device_classification.description: Software device to aid in the prediction or diagnosis of sepsis

fda_device_classification_description.description: Detailed description of the FDA classification and intended use of the device

uses_pii.description: Boolean indicating if the agent uses Personally Identifiable Information (PII)

uses_phi.description: Boolean indicating if the agent uses Protected Health Information (PHI)

physical_state.description: Physical state of the medical device (e.g., Software Device)

relations.description: Relationships between the medical device asset and other objects

uses.description: Objects that this medical device uses
